data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about LED Optimized Dimmer Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the LED Optimized Dimmer Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The LED Optimized Dimmer Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of LED Optimized Dimmer Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Pretty good dimmer. I have a few of these so I feel like a bit of an expert. They do work well but the one seems a bit finicky. What I mean is the light doesn’t stay the same dimness. 99.9% of the time has been good. I love having dimmers all over the house. Being able to adjust the brightness is awesome.
1#Dimmer switch. Didn’t work! Kept my lights blinking. Would not recommend any one to purchase it.
2#Saved me when I switched to LED. Work great, easy to install
3#3 of 4 don’t work. I installed 4 of these a few years ago, and now only one works. I liked them while they lasted, easy to use, for with the look of the house. Unfortunately three of them don’t work well. They flicker, they go only part of the way up or part of the way down in brightness when you move the slider. Sometimes they start low and slowly get brighter despite not touching the switch at all. Very disappointing.
4#Fits existing fixtures. Color spot on as well
5#Range doesn't seem to be as good as older switches. I really like these slide lever switches and have them installed all around my house. I noticed the most recent ones I bought don't seem to provide the same range on the dimmable LEDs though. Could be a difference in the bulbs though.
6#I does what is designed to do. Works a advertised.
7#Good dimmers. Needed to tone down new LED under-cabinet lights. They had a good price, arrived on time, installed without a hitch and work as advertised. Boom!
8#Junk. Didn’t last six weeks before the dimmer function died. No longer functions as a three-way.
9#1 of 3 units did not work properly. The, "Lutron Toggler LED+ Dimmer Switch, 3-way" works great for the 2 of 3 installed. 1 unit did not function as a 3-way, as if there was a missing part internally. I did not request a replacement, since I repurposed it as a typical single switch install.
10#worked once then quit. It worked once then quit so i returned it
11#LED lights STILL BUZZ despite this switch :-(. I bought this specifically, so my set of ceiling can LED lights would not “buzz“ while on. However, the lights still buzz, quite annoyingly, regardless of whether I adjust it to a dimmed setting or have it on full brightness. (By the way, my LED lights are designed to be “dimmable.”) Disappointing.
12#Good dimmer. Very easy to install. Dimmer work good. Just make sure your light is compatible.
13#Ivory is definitely not White. The dimmer works great, and it was easy to install. The color selections were: Ivory, Almond, and light Almond. I expected Ivory to be close to white. As can be seen in my attached photo, it is definitely not white. There switch plate is white.
14#Great Dimmer Switches. Nice to have a switch that looks like a typical switch but that also dims. Will put more of these around the house including the bathroom.
15#No flicker. Bought for LED lighting due to flicker when dimmed. No more flicker. Purchased these due to a good positive review. More expensive than HD or Lowes but are supposed to be much better quality. Made in Mexico (not China).
16#These are great. excellent product for LED dimmable lamps
17#Great switch, dimmer works with LED bulbs great. Just make sure of the color that you want. Almond, light almond and ivory are all close in color. Works great with LED dimmer options.
18#Only 2 of the 3 pack worked.... No way to return or replace that I can see... I ordered the 3 pack. Only 2 worked. We tried troubleshooting the one by trying it on different lights (I need 3 replaced) regular lights and LED lights and NOPE nothing... The other two worked. No way to return because it was a 3 pack and the other 2 are already installed.
19#Good value. Easy to understand written instructions, but also has a video online if still not certain.
20#Very hard to install. I've installed many dimmer switches previously and never had any issues (different brands). These were VERY frustrating to install. I normally use the screw connections (more secure). However, these are impossible to do well and very frustrating. The terminals are inset into the body with too much gap between the wire and the screw. You tighten the screw, and the wire just pops out from under the screw. There shouldn't be enough clearance to do that. If you try to make a loop in the wire to keep it in, there isn't enough room to have much of a loop. Next, I tried using the push-in connection. But the hole for that connection was too small for my 12-gauge wire. What should have been a 10-minute install took an hour of frustrating time... times 3 (I bought 3 switches). All 3 switches were the same. They worked fine once installed. But what a pain to get the wires connected!
21#Excellent quality. Bought for LED bulbs in bathrooms and for other LED bulbs in hallway, dining room and ceiling fans. No flickering, etc like cheap dimmers might cause. Very pleased.
22#They would not dim low enough. They would not dim enough for my customer and they flicker when you dim them. I bought thirty of them for a customer and she said take them out. I have them installed for Nicor dimmable recess led bulbs. I bought thirty of some other brand prior, but they did not dim as good as the Lutron. So I got sixty dimmers that I can't use. I think this dimmer would be good on another brand bulb. I can not find a toggle dimmer that works with these bulbs. I'm out over $1,300.00.
23#Love this style and am a repeat customer. Like the dimmer separate from switch
24#Junk! Save your money. Absolute junk, don’t buy, cheap plastic, can’t get the wires on the screw, the toggle itself feels like it’s going to fall off
25#Great 3-way dimmer! Replaced an old rotary dimmer with it. It works very well!
26#Great switches. 3 ways are never any fun but these were not bad once I figured the wiring that was in this house.
27#Works great. I installed it in my bathroom for the lights above the sink. I dim it at night when I go to bed. If I use the bathroom in the night, I'm not blinded awake by bright lights.
28#Works for LED and fits in old style decorative switch plate. Tried another style and was not happy as it changed brightness and went off with vibration. This one has worked well. Brightness can be set and switch used without changing it.
29#Cured flickering LED lights. I bought LED lights that were dimmable but had no idea that my older Lutron dimmer was not up to the task. Installed years ago before LEDs were popular they worked fine with incandescent but not my LEDs. This new Lutron cured the problem. Adjusts perfectly within a wide range.
30#Replaced older Lutron dimmer - no more flicker on my LEDs! Perfect dimming of six recessed can LED fixtures. No flicker, no hesitation.
31#Best for use with LEDS. Old dimmer switch caused the LED's in my ceiling fan to go bad! New switch cured that problem! ; )
32#Great Product. Works Extremely Well, Especially with LED Candelabra Lamps. Highly recommend that you install these in your 3-way circuits. Watch you amperage load if you are not converting to LEDs.
33#LED light dimmer -Iffy at best. Pros: The 'slider' does not move to full on like some others when the light is turned off. Works with 3 way switches. CONS: Finding -if- your LED bulbs are "compatible" with this is a chore. Even if it "works" it is far from perfect. Example: I tried it with equivalent 40 watt bulbs. The 'dimming' is very limited before they start flickering off, so they go from 480 lumen to 380? lumen. Not a lot of sense in using it if it has such a limited range. Something else I noticed, it doesn't 'appear' that the LED lights are quite as bright (when at full brightness) as when the standard ON/OFF switch was used, although I have no way of verifying such. My opinion - buy at you own risk if you intend to use this with LED lighting.
34#silent, solid and adjustable. Solid and easy to install. No buzz. Running high-end dimmable LED wall lamps and ceiling lights with highly controllable brightness. The adjustable setting on the internal face allows fine-tuning.
35#Nice dimming switch. This is your standard switch, works great and looks nice. Easy install
36#1/9 switches failed after 3 years of use. These are bulky, so you might have trouble fitting these in a two gang, and probably not be able to fit in a three gang. Otherwise these were great. I’m leaving a review today because I installed 9 of these about three years ago. One failed today - turned on the switch, heard a sizzling sound and it no longer worked. Shorted out. This switch controlled an all LED light circuit in 10 canisters (led retrofit kits). Too bad the warranty is only one year. these are some expensive light switches!
37#LED, CFL, Incandescent Dimmer - 1pole or 3way. Excellent switch, fits in standard switch plate, simple install.
38#High quality fine tunable. Nice to have adjustment for lowest light level.
39#First one died immediately. Second one has been no problem. Works as advertised. I hear a buzzing/humming noise from the lights, however my parents do not. It works tho. The lights are LED dimmable and it fits perfectly under a normal switch cover. I have two switches for the one light and as long as you Kill the power to the breaker and ReWire it exactly as it came out, you should have no problem installing it. Or call an electrician.
40#works well and easy to install. Works well and was easy to install.
41#Dimmer Switch. Hard to find the right dimmer switch but this one fit the bill perfectly.
42#Good and versatile. In switching to all LED bulbs, new dimmers were required. Many are Decora, but in keeping with the age and character of the house, I wanted a toggle. This is perfect, and it came in ivory like the switches next to it. I was also able to set the minimum brightness and that's a plus.
43#honest review. Item came very quick and worked perfectly. Nice because big box doesn't carry very many Ivory color items and am in a rental that needs this color.
44#Better dimming range than others, no flicker or buzz; does not come on set below ~80%. This dimmer works much better than the one it replaced. I gave this 4 stars because it does not turn on the 8 -100W equivalent Feit LED lights when the dimmer is set at about 80% or lower. The lights are within the load capacity. This dimmer was rated "The best of the best" in a review, but if holding the dimming setting and switching on from that setting is important to you, this one may not be the best choice. So long as you are ok with turning it almost all the way up to full bright to turn it on, then dimming to the desired setting, this dimmer will work well.
45#Great dimmer. I am using one dimmer in a 3-way dining room light and either switch will turn on the light to the preset dimness. Wasn't sure if I needed 2 dimmers but one works very well.
46#Easy to install, works well with my LED fixture. Seems to work well - I installed it feeding an LED fixture with 8 bulbs. Easy to install
47#pleased with product. Received as ordered, pleased with product.
